intro: Ardisia rubescens var. rubescens, commonly known as the red beauty ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, red berries. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its berries are toxic to humans and livestock, so caution is advised when handling or planting this species.
